intro: Bidens artemisiifolia f. rubra, commonly known as redstem ironweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its reddish stems and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and open areas, thriving in full sun. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges, and the flowers bloom in late summer to early autumn. This variant is often found in the eastern and central United States, where it plays a role in supporting local pollinators.
